author: Special Correspondent
text:
A district-level inspection committee to submit a report: Collector

All homes, orphanages and hostels in the district should admit inmates only after getting registered with the competent authority, Collector M. Karunakaran has said.

Inaugurating a capacity-building programme on child protection here on Thursday, Dr. Karunakaran said all orphanages, homes and hostels, where women and children were being admitted, should be registered with a competent authority as per the State government’s stipulation. In other words, all orphanages, children’s homes, hostel for students, hostels attached to the educational institutions, industrial houses and the hostels for working women, etc. should be registered for getting proper licence.

Application for registering homes or hostels could be obtained from the Collectorate, Department of Social Welfare or the Office of Child Protection Committee.

“A district-level inspection committee, comprising a team of officials, will soon visit the orphanages, homes and hostels across the district for ensuring a safe environment to the inmates, particularly women and children and submit its report to the Collector,” Dr. Karunakaran said.

A team of experts spoke on Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012 and Tamil Nadu Hostels and Homes for Women and Children (Regulation) Act, 2014.

District Revenue Officer M.G. Kulandaivel, Cheranmahadevi Sub-Collector V. Vishnu, Revenue Divisional Officers P. Fermi Vidya (Tirunelveli) and S. Venkatesh (Tenkasi) participated in the meeting.
title: ‘Admission in homes, hostels, orphanages only with licence’
